intro: Spilanthes popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes, which includes several species known for their unique floral structures and medicinal properties. The plant produces small, yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Spilanthes popayanensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils at higher elevations.
